author: Jeff Parsons
title: The most hi-tech toilet you'll ever urinate on: Rugby World Cup urinal game will test your pee power
text:
Many pints will be drunk and passed in UK pubs during the thrilling Rugby World Cup .
So one enterprising establishment has hit on a very hi-tech way to keep blokes amused during the inevitable toilet break .
They've installed a video game in the urinals that you play by peeing .
In the game, you're given the task of controlling a player running for the try line. You need to steer your player past the oncoming opponents.
And how do you do that?
The game eloquently asks you to use your "stream" to guide the player.
An image of the game was uploaded to photo-sharing site Imgur today - sadly with no knowledge of which pub had implemented the clever game.
This pub/bar has a game you play by peeing.
Created by betting company Betsafe, the game has even been endorsed by former England rugby star Kyran Bracken.
"The Betsafe Rugby Challenge is a really innovative and fun way for guys, and their tackle, to get involved in the rugby. This has to be the first time in Rugby World Cup history that someone has the opportunity to win tickets to the Final by nipping to the gents," Bracken said.
Ichthyosis/CC BY-SA Bog standard: An average non-video game urinal
Betsafe says 75 bars and pubs across the UK will be installing the game for a limited time until Sunday, October 25.
So if you want to test your "power in front of the porcelain" you best get down to the boozer pronto.
